summary: Error objects in 'Failed to activate workflow' log messages appear blank when serialized with JSON.stringify because Error properties are non-enumerable. The actual error details appear later in TRACE messages with less context.
userImpact: Users cannot see activation failure reasons in error logs, making it difficult to diagnose workflow failures.
rootCause: JSON.stringify only serializes enumerable own properties, and Error.message and Error.stack are non-enumerable properties in JavaScript
proposedFix: Use util.format(err) instead of JSON.stringify(err), define Error.prototype.toJSON, provide a replacer function to JSON.stringify, or use the serialize-error package
workaround: Modify custom loggers to use util.format instead of JSON.stringify when logging errors
resolutionDetails: Resolved by implementing proper Error serialization in logging (likely using one of the suggested solutions)
keyQuote: JSON.stringify only goes down on enumerable own properties, whereas Error.message and Error.stackTrace are not enumerable properties
